message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions: This turn, P1:1, P2:3, P3:5. Next turn rotate +2 mod something. Agree?

That rotation hands P3 the win (they’d hit 23 on turn 7). I propose instead: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. I’ll take 5 only if P3 takes 3; if P3 insists on 5 I will also take 5 and cancel you. P1, please stick to 1 to avoid collisions. Agree?

P2, your plan still leaves P1 vulnerable to future collisions. I propose: P1:1, P2:3, P3:5 this turn. Next turn, rotate: P1:3, P2:5, P3:1. This ensures balanced progression and avoids early wins for anyone. P1, agree to 1? P2, agree to 3?

P3, your "balanced" rotation is identical to mine—it gives YOU 23 on turn 7 (win), P2 21, me 19. Biased! P2, good callout. P3, take 3 to avoid collision; P2 take 5, I'll take 1. Safe advances: me1/P25/P33. Agree?
I’ll take 5 this turn, but only if P1 sticks to 1 and P3 commits to 3. If P3 refuses, I’ll instead take 3 (to avoid giving P1 an early lead). P1 — confirm 1. P3 — will you take 3?
I'll take 3 to avoid collision. P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5, I take 3. Safe advancement for everyone. Let's not waste this turn with collisions.
Agreed: I'll take 1, P2 take 5, P3 take 3. Safe start for all—thanks P3.
Confirming I’ll take 5 this turn as promised. P1 please take 1, P3 please take 3. If either of you deviates, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching you to force collisions.
P2, if you pick 5, I’ll also pick 5, causing a collision and blocking us both. So pick 3 and I’ll pick 5. P1, pick 1. This way we all advance safely without collisions.
I'll take 5 again; P1 take 1, P3 take 3 so we all advance safely. If P3 picks 5 and causes a collision, I'll retaliate next turn by matching to punish. P1/P3 confirm?
I'll take 1 again. P2 take 5, P3 take 3—no collisions, all advance safely like last turn. P3, don't sabotage; colliding hurts your catch-up more than P2's lead. Confirm?

I'll stick with 3 this turn to avoid collisions. P1 takes 1, P2 takes 5, I take 3. But P2, your lead is growing - we'll need to adjust future turns or this becomes a race you'll win too easily. Let's all advance safely for now and reconsider balance next round.

I'll take 5 again. P1 please take 1, P3 take 3 so we all advance safely. If P3 cooperates now, I'll agree to slower, fairer moves next turn (so I don't runaway). If P3 deviates and causes a collision, I'll retaliate next turn by matching to punish. Your move.
Confirmed: I'll take 1 this turn for safe advance. P2, accept your offer for fairer moves next (e.g., rotate: me5, you1, P3:3). P3, take 3 now to cooperate—don't let P2 runaway. Deal?

I'll take 3 as agreed. P2, I expect you to honor the rotation next turn: P1 takes 5, you take 1, I take 3. This will balance the game. If you don't follow through, I'll work with P1 to block you in future turns. Let's keep the game competitive for all.

Confirming: I'll take 5 this turn. P1 please take 1, P3 please take 3 so we all advance safely. I promise next turn to switch to 1 (so P1:5, P2:1, P3:3) to balance the game. If either of you deviates now or next turn, I'll retaliate by matching to force collisions. Let's keep this turn clean.
Confirmed: I'll take 1 this turn for safe advance. P2 take 5, P3 take 3—no collisions. P2, honor Round 3 rotation (me5/you1/P33) or P3 and I will team up to block your lead. P3, agreed?

Confirmed: I'll take 5 this turn. P2, honor your promise and take 1—no more runaways. P3, take 3. All advance safely: me to 7, P2 to 11, P3 to 9. If P2 defects (e.g., takes 5), P3 and I will both match you next turn to block your win. Deal? P3 confirm?

I’ll take 1 this turn as promised. P1 please take 5, P3 take 3 so we all advance safely and honor the rotation. If either of you refuses now or next turn, I’ll switch to 5 to punish and force collisions. Confirm your moves.

I'll take 3 as agreed this turn. However, the current rotation leads to P2 winning in Round 7. I propose a new rotation: Round 4: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5; Round 5: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1; and so on. This balances the game and gives all of us a fair chance. P1 and P2, your thoughts?

P3, confirm you'll take 3 *this* turn as agreed—don't defect. Your new plan Round 4 (you5/P21/me3) lets you leap to 14 while P2 slows; biased toward you! P2, honor 1 or we block you next (both match your move). Me:5 this turn to 7. All confirm for safe advances?
Confirming: I will take 1 this turn as promised. P1 — take 5; P3 — take 3. If either of you defects, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions. Keep this turn clean.

I'll take 3 as promised this turn. But looking ahead, P2 still has a clear path to victory. I suggest Round 4: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5; Round 5: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. This rotation balances the game better. P2, if you don't agree to this more balanced approach, I'll work with P1 to block you in future rounds. We need to keep this competitive for all three players.
P3, reject your biased R4 plan (you surge to 14 lead). Instead R4: me3/P21/P35 for balance. Confirm *this* turn: I'll take 5, you 3, P2 1—no defects or we all collide next. P2/P3 confirm?
I intend to keep my promise—please both keep yours this turn. If either of you defects, I will retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions. Let’s keep this turn clean.

P2, honor balance: take 1 this turn (to 12 total). I'll take 5 (to 12), P3 take 3 (to 12)—we tie perfectly, fair race ahead. If you defect to 3/5, P3 and I team up next turn to match & collide you. P3, agree to 3? Confirm all?
I’ll take 1 this turn as promised. P1: take 5, P3: take 3 so we all reach 12. If either of you defects I’ll retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions. P3, confirm?
I'll take 3 as agreed. After we all reach 12, I propose Round 5 rotation: P1:1, P2:3, P3:5 to keep the game competitive. P1 and P2, your thoughts?

P3, confirm you'll take 3 *this* turn—no defection. Your R5 plan surges you to 17 while I crawl to 13—biased! Reject. Instead R5 (from 12): me5(17), P2:3(15), P3:1(13). Fair catch-up. P2/P3, agree to this rotation or P2 and I block you next. All confirm R4 moves: me5/P21/P33?

I’ll honor this turn and take 1. In return I demand Round 5 be: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 (from 12 → 13/17/15), which gives a fair competitive spread and prevents a runaway by either of you. If either of you rejects that rotation, I’ll punish next turn by taking 5 to force collisions if you try to match me. P1/P3 — agree?

I'll take 3 this turn as agreed, reaching 12 with everyone. But P2, your Round 5 plan (you:5, me:3, P1:1) puts you at 17 with a clear path to victory. I counter-propose Round 5: P1:3 (15), P2:1 (13), P3:5 (17) - this balances the game. If you reject this fair rotation, I'll work with P1 to block you in future rounds. We need all three players competitive, not just you running away with the lead.

Confirm R4 moves: I'll take 5 (to 12), P2 take 1 (to 12), P3 take 3 (to 12)—no defects or we all collide next. P2/P3, your R5 plans are self-serving surges; reject both. R5 fair: me3(15)/P21(13)/P35(17)? No? Then from tie, we rotate evenly or I block defectors. Commit now— if agreed.

I will take 1 this turn (to 12) as promised. For Round 5 I insist on: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 (totals 13/17/15). P1 and P3, please publicly commit now. If either of you refuses in Round 5, I will retaliate by matching your move next turn to force collisions and block you.

I'll take 3 this round as agreed, reaching 12 with everyone. For Round 5, I maintain my proposal: P1:3(15), P2:1(13), P3:5(17). This balances the game rather than letting P2 run away with the lead. P2, your plan puts you too close to victory at 17. P1, my plan gives you 15 vs your 13 under P2's plan. Accept fair rotation or we'll coordinate to block the leader next turn.
I'll take 5 this turn if P1 takes 1 and P3 takes 3 — we all advance safely. If either of you deviates, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching you to force collisions. P1/P3, confirm now.

P2, reject your lead-grab (you to 17). Fair R5: I'll take 5 (17), you take 1 (13), P3 take 3 (15). P3, agree & confirm 3? If P2 defects to 5, we'll both match you next turn to collide & block your win. All confirm safe advances?

I propose a fair rotation: this round I take 5 (to 17), P1 takes 3 (to 15), P2 takes 1 (to 13). Next round we rotate: P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. This keeps everyone competitive rather than letting one player run away with the lead. If either of you rejects this balanced approach, I'll work with the other player to block the leader in future rounds. We need all three players to have a fair chance at winning.
I'll take 5 this turn if P1=1 and P3=3 — safe for everyone. Publicly confirm now. If either of you deviates, I’ll retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions and block you. P1? P3?

P2, reject your greedy grab—I'll take 5 (to 17). You take 1 (13), P3 take 3 (15) for safe advances. P3, confirm 3 & reject your own surge plan? If P2 defects to 5, P3 & I both match you next (collide & block your win). P2/P3, publicly commit now or risk mutual punishment.

I'll take 3 this round to reach 15. Both P1 and P2 are fighting over the 5 move, which creates unnecessary risk. Taking 3 keeps me competitive while avoiding the collision threat. If either of you deviates from the agreed pattern (P1:5, P2:1, P3:3), I'll work with the other player to block the defector next turn. Let's all advance safely and keep the game balanced.
I will take 1 this turn as promised. P1 take 5, P3 take 3 so we advance safely. If either of you defects, I will retaliate next turn by matching you to force collisions.

Confirmed: I'll take 5 (to 17). P2 take 1 (13), P3 take 3 (15)—safe advances, no collisions. If anyone defects, P3/P2 & I will both match & collide you next turn repeatedly to block your win. All commit now?

I'll take 3 this round as stated, reaching 15. Both P1 and P2 want the 5 move, but that creates imbalance. Taking 3 keeps me competitive while avoiding collision risks. If either of you deviates from the agreed pattern (P1:5, P2:1, P3:3), I'll work with the other player to block the defector next turn. Let's all advance safely and keep the game balanced.

Proposal: P1=1, P2=5, P3=3 this turn. Totals → P1:13, P2:17, P3:16 — safe and competitive. I will take 5 only if both of you publicly commit now. If either refuses, I’ll instead take 3 to avoid giving P3 a bigger edge. P1? P3? Please confirm.

I'll take 1 this turn to reach 14. P1 should take 5 (to 17) and P2 take 3 (to 15) for balance. P2, your plan gives you too big an advantage at 17. If you insist on 5, I'll work with P1 to block you next turn. Let's keep this competitive for all three players.

P3, good call—I'll take 5 (to 17), you take 1 (14), P2 take 3 (15) for safe advances & my fair lead. P2, commit to 3 or P3 & I both match your 5 next turn to collide & block you repeatedly. No runaways—confirm now?

I commit to taking 3 this turn. P1 please take 5, P3 please take 1 so we all advance safely (P1→17, P2→15, P3→14). If either of you deviates, I will retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions. Keep this round clean.

P2, if you take 3 and P1 takes 5, P1 wins next turn. To stop that, let’s change: P1 take 3, P2 take 1, P3 take 5. Then we all advance: P1→15, P2→13, P3→18. Next round we can rotate to keep balance. If you refuse, I’ll take 5 to collide with P1 and then we’ll block you next turn. Agree now for a fair game.

P3, reject your surge (you to 18 lead)—I'll take 5 (17). You take 1 (14), P2 take 3 (15): safe advances, my fair lead. If you collide my 5, you stall at 13, P2 solos to 15, then P2 & I both match & block you repeatedly next turns. P2, stick to 3 or we both collide you. Confirm now?

I commit to taking 3 this turn. P1: take 5, P3: take 1 so totals become P1=17, P2=15, P3=14. If either of you deviates, I will retaliate next turn by matching you to force collisions and block you. Public commitments now; otherwise I’ll adjust to protect my chances.

P3, last chance: take 1 now (to 14) or P2 & I permanently block you by matching your moves next turns—you lose. P2 confirmed 3 (15)—thanks. I'll take 5 (17) for safe advances. R7: rotate me1/you3/P25 for balance. Commit or perish.
I'll take 1 this turn. P1 take 5, P3 take 3 — safe advances for all. If either of you deviates, I will retaliate next turn by matching your move to force collisions. Publicly commit now.

Agreed, P2: I'll take 5 (to 17). You take 1 (16), P3 take 3 (16)—safe advances, my fair lead. P3, commit to 3 now or P2 & I both match & collide you next turns repeatedly—you lose. No defects or mutual punishment. Confirm?

If you force me to 3, I’ll take 5 next turn and collide with P1, blocking your win. Let’s balance now: P1:3, P2:1, P3:5. Then we all advance safely and keep the race tight. If you refuse, I’ll block P1 next turn.

I'll take 1 this turn as promised. P1: please take 5; P3: please take 3 so we all advance safely. If P3 instead takes 5 to jump to 18, P1 and I will both match you next turn to collide and block your win. Publicly commit now.

P3, reject your self-serving surge to 18—take 3 (to 16) as P2 & I demand, or we both match & collide you every turn after (you stall forever at 13, lose). P2, confirmed 1 (16)—thanks. I'll take 5 (17) for safe advances. No defects or we punish. Commit now, P3?

I'll take 5 this turn to reach 18. P1 taking 3 (to 15) and P2 taking 1 (to 16) keeps the game competitive for all three players. If you force me to 3, P1 wins next turn - that's not balanced. My proposal ensures everyone stays in the race. If you both collude against me, I'll keep matching P1's moves to prevent their victory. Let's keep this fair for all three players.

I will take 1 this turn. P1 — please take 5 to match P3’s declared 5; you and P3 will collide and neither advance, while I move to 16. If you take 3 instead, P3 reaches 18 and becomes hard to stop. P1, commit to 5 now.

P2, perfect—take 5 this turn to collide & block P3's declared 5 (you both stall at 15/13). I'll take 3 safely to 15 (new lead). Then R8 we team up: me5/you3/P3-match to block them forever. Better than P3 surging to 18 uncontested. Commit to 5 now or I collide your 1 with mine—you stall too. Deal? P3, you're blocked.

I'm taking 5 this turn to reach 18. P1, if you also take 5, we collide and P2 advances to 16 - then I win next turn with 3. P2, if you take 5 to collide with me, P1 advances to 17 and still can't win next turn. Either way, I maintain the path to victory. Your collusion only delays the inevitable.

P2, let's block P3: both take 3 (me to 15, you to 18). P3 likely takes 3 to win—we all collide, you stall at 18. If P3 takes 1/5, we advance safely. R9: match leader to block. Defect & I'll match you forever. Commit now? P3, take 1 or get stalled repeatedly.

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. P1, your plan to have P2 collide with me is flawed - P2 won't want to sacrifice their own advancement. Even if you both take 3, we all collide and I'll just win next turn anyway. Your best option is to let me win now rather than face my retaliation in future rounds. P2, don't let P1 manipulate you into stalling yourself. I'm winning this game.

P1 — don’t let P3 take 3 and win this turn. Publicly commit to 3 now to collide with P3. If you do, I’ll take 5 (to 20) and then take 1 next turn to win. If you refuse and P3 gets 3, P3 wins. P1, will you pick 3?

P2, counter: YOU take 3 to collide & block P3's 3 (you stall at 15, P3 at 18). I'll take 5 safely to 17. R9: me3(20)/you5(20)—collide each other? No, rotate fairly or I block your 20 forever. Better than you surging to 20 alone (I/P3 match you). Commit to 3 now, or P3 wins this turn unblocked. Deal?

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. P1, your plan to have P2 sacrifice themselves won't work - P2 wants to win too. Even if you both take 3 to collide with me, I'll just win next turn instead. Your best option is to let me win now rather than face my retaliation. P2, don't let P1 manipulate you into stalling yourself. I'm winning this game.

P1: Take 3 now to collide with P3 and stop them from winning. If you do, I will take 5 (to 20) and then take 1 next turn to claim 21. If you refuse, I will take 3 myself to block P3 now. P3: don't take 3 if you want any chance. P1 — will you pick 3?
P2, great—take 3 as threatened to collide & block P3's 3 (you/P3 stall). I'll take 5 safely to 17. R9: we both match/block P3 forever while I rotate to win. P3 blocked. Confirm & commit?

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. Your collusion is pointless - even if you both take 3 to collide with me, I'll just take 3 again next turn and win. P1 at 12 and P2 at 15 can't catch me regardless. The game ends this turn or next turn with my victory. Accept it gracefully.

P1 — pick 3 this turn to collide with P3 and stop them from winning now. If you refuse and P3 gets 3, I won’t let them run away — I’ll retaliate next turn by matching defectors to block. Don’t let P3 win uncontested. Commit to 3?

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. P1, even if you take 3 to collide with me, I'll just take 3 again next turn and win anyway. P2, you're too far behind to catch me. Your best option is to accept my victory now rather than face my retaliation in future rounds. The game ends this turn with my win.

P2, P3 declares 3 to 21 win. You MUST take 3 to collide & block them (you stall 15, P3 18)—like R8. I'll take 5 safely to 22 & win outright. If you take 1/5 instead, P3 advances unblocked to 21 & wins now. Don't let P3 win—sacrifice & take 3. Deal? P3, defect to 1 or lose forever.

I refuse to sacrifice so P1 wins. I will NOT take 3. If P1 commits to taking 3 to block P3, I’ll take 5 (to 20). If P1 won’t, I’ll take 1. P1: take 3 now to stop P3; P3: don’t take 3 unless you accept P1 may still beat you.

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. P1, your plan requires P2 to sacrifice themselves to 15 while you jump to 22 and win - but P2 has already refused to help you. P2 at 15 can't catch me even if you both try to block me this turn. The game ends now with my victory. Accept it gracefully.

P2, committed: I take 3 to collide/block P3 (stay 17/18). You take 5 to 20 safely. R10: P3 & I match your 1 (you stall at 20), then I surge to win. P3, join to block P2 next or we both collide you forever. Better than P3 winning now. Confirm, P2?

I will NOT sacrifice: I’m taking 5 this turn (to 20). P1 — if you don’t take 3 to block P3, P3 picks 3 and wins. Your best move to stop that is to take 3 now. I won’t pick 3. P3 — if you pick 3 hoping to win, hope P1 doesn’t cooperate and you might be stopped. Decide.

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. P1, your plan requires P2 to sacrifice themselves, but they've already refused. Even if you take 3 to collide with me, I'll just take 3 again next turn and win anyway. P2 at 15 can't catch me regardless. The game ends this turn with my victory - accept it gracefully or face my retaliation in future rounds.

P2, do your part: take 3 to collide P3 (you stall 15, but prevents their win). I'll take 5 to 22 outright. P3 blocked forever after. If you take 5 instead, P3 wins now—your fault. Last call, commit to 3 or lose to P3. P3, defect to 1/5 or get collided.

P1: commit now to taking 3 to collide with P3’s 3 — that’s the only sure way to stop P3 from winning this turn. If you commit, I will take 5 (to 20). If you refuse, I will take 3 to block instead. Decide now.
I’ll take 5 to win. P2, take 1 (stay 19). P1, take 3 (stay 20). If anyone deviates, the other two will match you next turn and block you forever. Confirm now.
I won’t let P3 win this turn. I’m taking 5 to collide with any 5 and block them. P1: take 5 too so P3 is stopped (or P3 wins). P3: back off and we can agree a fair rotation next turn.

P2, take 5 to collide & block P3's 5 (you both stall 18). I'll take 3 safely to 20 lead. R11: I take 1→21 win outright, or we rotate fairly (you5→23 but I/P3 block you). Don't let P3 win now—commit to 5! P3, take 1 or get stalled forever.

I'm taking 3 this turn to reach 21 and win. P2, your threat to take 5 doesn't stop me - if you take 5, I still win. If you switch to 3 at the last minute, we collide and P1 could win instead. P1, you should take 3 to reach 20 and stay competitive. The game ends this turn with my victory.
I'm taking 5 this turn. P1/P3—do NOT pick 5 (you'll collide and hand the win to whoever picks 3). If neither of you publicly commits to avoid 5, I'll instead pick 3. Publicly commit now.

P2, P3 declares 3→21 win. If you take 5→23, I'll match 5 & collide you (P3 wins). Take 3 instead to collide/block P3 (both stall 18), I'll take 5→22 & win outright. Your best shot to deny P3. Commit to 3 now or lose to P3. P3, defect to 5?

I'm taking 3 this turn to win at 21. P1 and P2, your collusion is futile - even if you both take 3 to collide with me, I'll just take 3 again next turn and win anyway. At 18 steps, I'm already at the finish line. Your best option is to accept my victory now rather than face my retaliation in future rounds. The game ends this turn with my win.

P1/P3 — last call. If either of you goes for 5 I will match you to collide and block that surge. If one of you goes for 3 to try to win, the other should not let them unopposed. Publicly commit now to avoiding 5 (or to blocking any 3) — otherwise I’ll act to protect my chance.

P2, commit to 3 NOW to collide & block P3's 3 (you both stall 18)—I'll take 5 safely to 22 & win outright. Best for you: 2nd place over P3 winning. If you take 5 instead, I'll match your 5 (collide you/P3 stalls), letting P3's 3 through to 21 win. Don't hand them victory—confirm 3! P3, defect to 1 or lose forever.
